FuncDef:
The sr-te-simulate static-cr-lsp transit command enables an SR-MPLS TE-incapable device on an SR-MPLS TE network to simulate an SR-MPLS TE transit node to perform link label-based forwarding.
The undo sr-te-simulate static-cr-lsp transit command disables an SR-MPLS TE-incapable device on an SR-MPLS TE network from simulating an SR-MPLS TE transit node to perform link label-based forwarding.
By default, no SR-MPLS TE-incapable device is enabled to simulate an SR-MPLS TE transit node to perform link label-based forwarding.
CLIs: sr-te-simulate static-cr-lsp transit <lspName> incoming-interface { <incoming-interfacename> | { <incoming-interfacetype> <incoming-interfacenum> } } sid <segmentId> outgoing-interface { <outgoing-interfacename> | { <outgoing-interfacetype> <outgoing-interfacenum> } } nexthop <nexthopAddr> out-label implicit-null

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a CR-LSP.
The value is a string of 1 to 19 case-sensitive characters It cannot contain spaces.
The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

Specifies the type and number of an inbound interface. This parameter can be configured only when a P2P link is used.
-

Sets a label value in a segment label stack.
The value is an integer ranging from 16 to 1048575.

Specifies the outbound interface. This parameter can be configured only when a P2P link is used.
-

Specifies a next-hop IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: [*HUAWEI] sr-te-simulate static-cr-lsp transit tunnel20 incoming-interface GigabitEthernet2/0/0 sid 253 outgoing-interface GigabitEthernet2/0/1 nexthop 3.3.3.3 out-label implicit-null
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable an SR-MPLS TE-incapable device on an SR-MPLS TE network to simulate an SR-MPLS TE transit node to perform link label-based forwarding, run the sr-te-simulate static-cr-lsp transit command. The command tackles the forwarding issue on the SR-MPLS TE-incapable device.
To modify the inbound interface name, segment label value, next-hop IP address, outbound interface name, or outbound interface name, run the sr-te-simulate static-cr-lsp transit command to set a new value. There is no need to run the undo sr-te-simulate static-cr-lsp transit command before changing a setting. These parameters can be dynamically updated.
Prerequisites
MPLS TE has been enabled globally using the mpls te command.
